column4: I need help getting TwinView working properly. Is anyone available to help me out?
did you install your drivers yet?
what drivers did you get?
try pressing alt+F2
then put in your password.
I said to put gksudo nvidia-settings
I have run this alot in the past 2 days.says I don't have the drivers
have you restarted since installing the drivers?>
then I want you to remove the current nvidia drivers. Press Alt+F2 and type, gksudo jockey-gtk
ok, now the Hardware drivers dialog comes up that I used to install the drivers in the first place
now remove the current drivers and go to http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index5.aspx?lang=en-us and get the drivers you need.
I'll help you after you've got those drivers.
thought I could use the nvidia-glx-new ones
these aren't going to work then?
you will be. But it'll be the ones from nvidia. I've had problems with the silly repo ones.
now, you need to press Alt+f2 then type sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop Then log into the terminal and go to where you downloaded the drivers. Type chmod +x Nvi* then type ./Nvi{Tab}
if anything breaks, in the terminal type sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start
hit enter after Nvi* or ./Nvi{Tab} or enter after both?
then do this ./Nvi*
but do it in the folder the file is in.
in a terminal type sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
ok I got to work once the drivers were installed..thanks for your help : )))
